Reasoning: **My Turn to Discard**

Okay, here's the situation. It's Ante 3/8, Round 8, and I'm in the SELECTING\_HAND stage. The Big Blind is looming, requiring 3000 chips, and I'm currently at zero. I have $14 and three hands remaining. I've got two discards left, which is crucial. My goal? Snag that elusive Purple Seal 10 of Diamonds. I've got a couple of powerful Jokers: DNA, Brainstorm, Blue Joker, Mail-In Rebate and Ride the Bus.

My hand right now is: Ace of Spades, 5 of Hearts, 4 of Hearts, 10 of Clubs, 5 of Clubs, 4 of Diamonds, 4 of Diamonds, and 2 of Diamonds. No dice on the 10 of Diamonds, unfortunately. No Jacks either, so no immediate Mail-In Rebate value. And since I haven't played a hand yet this round, Ride the Bus is irrelevant for now. The deck has a healthy 39 cards remaining, meaning the 10 of Diamonds should be lurking in there.

The game plan is simple: maximize my chances of finding the 10 of Diamonds. I've got two discards and three hands. Since DNA copies the first played card, I need to make that card the 10 of Diamonds to be copied by Brainstorm. I'm going to discard the five cards that are *not* the 10 of Diamonds. With 8 cards, I need to discard the irrelevant cards, which are: Ace of Spades, 5 of Hearts, 4 of Hearts, 10 of Clubs, and 5 of Clubs. That leaves me with the 4 of Diamonds x2 and 2 of Diamonds.

There's no point in keeping the 4s as my focus is that 10 of Diamonds. It's time to discard. My intention is to set up a situation where my first hand contains only the 10 of Diamonds, so I must discard the aforementioned 5 cards.

Now, before I commit, let's verify everything. Ride the Bus doesn't matter yet. I haven't played any hands in this round. DNA will trigger on the *first played* hand if it only contains 1 card. The target card is probably in the deck. I'm discarding 1-5, which are AS, 5H, 4H, 10C, and 5C. I'm double checking my previous analysis, because I need to get this right. Everything looks good.

My gameplan all along has been to find the 10 of Diamonds for exactly this reason.

Playing only the 10 of Diamonds is the only way to get this right. The 10 of Diamonds will be copied twice. This is an absolutely crucial play.

*   Mult: 2 (base) + 10 (Mail-In Rebate Holo) + 7 (Ride the Bus) = 19 mult.
*   Score: 83 * 19 = 1577 chips.

This seems like a solid first hand. The score, 1577 chips, puts me roughly halfway to the target. With two more hands with these bonus 10 of Diamonds, this target should be easily met. I absolutely should *not* play the King of Hearts as my first hand, because that *would* reset Ride the Bus.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
